juzs.text: He said, “And what, O messengers, is your mission?”
They said, “We have been sent to a people in sin
“And to bring on stones of clay
“Marked by your Lord, for those who trespass beyond bounds.”
Then We saved those believers who were there
But We did not find there any just muslim, except in one house
And We left there a sign for those who fear the terrible penalty
And in Moses was another sign. Behold, We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority
But Pharaoh turned back with his advisors and said, “A liar, or one possessed.”
So We led him and his forces, and cast them into the sea, and the blame was his
And the ‘Ad was another sign. Behold, We sent against them the devastating wind
It left nothing that it came up against. It reduced it to ruin
And the Thamud was another sign. Behold, they were told, “Enjoy yourselves for a little while.”
But they rebelled against the command of their Lord. So the stunning noise seized them, even while they looked on
Then they could not stand, nor could they help themselves
So were the people of Noah before them, for they wickedly transgressed
With power and skill did We construct the firmament, for it is We Who create the vastness of space
And We have spread out the earth. How excellently do We spread it out
And of everything We have created pairs, that you may receive instruction
Then hasten to God. I am from Him a warner to you, clear and open
And do not make an object of worship with God. I am from Him a warner to you, clear and open
Similarly, no messenger came to the peoples before them, except that they said of him in like manner, “A deceiver, or one possessed.”
Is this the legacy they have transmitted one to another? No, they are a people transgressing beyond bounds
So turn away from them. There will be no blame on you
But teach, for teaching benefits the believers
I only created jinn and humans so that they may worship Me
No sustenance do I require of them, nor do I require that they feed Me
For God is He Who gives all sustenance. He is Lord, powerful, and steadfast forever
For the wrongdoers, their portion is like the portion of their people of earlier generations. So do not let them ask Me to hasten that portion
Woe then to the unbelievers on account of their day. The day promised to them
By the mountain
By a decree inscribed
In parchment unfolded
By the much-frequented house
By the canopy raised high
And by the ocean that is filled
Indeed the doom from your Lord will indeed come to pass
There are none who can avert it
On the day that the firmament will be in dreadful commotion
And the mountains will fly near and far
Then woe that day to those who treat truth as falsehood
That play in shallow things
That day they will be thrust down to the fire of hell, irresistibly
“This,” it will be said, “Is the fire that you used to deny
“Is this then a fake, or is it you who do not see
“Burn therein, for it is the same whether you bear it with patience or not. You will receive the reward of your deeds.”
As for the righteous, they will be in gardens, and in happiness
Enjoying the bliss that their Lord has bestowed on them. And their Lord will deliver them from the penalty of the fire
Eat and drink for enjoyment and health, because of your deeds
They will recline on thrones arranged in ranks, and We will join them to companions with beautiful eyes
And those who believe and whose family follow them in faith, We will join them with their family, and We will not deprive them of any of their works, each person is responsible for their deeds
And We will give them all fruit and meat, anything they desire
There they will exchange, one with another, a cup free of nonsense, and free of harm
Around them will be youthfulness, like pearls well guarded
They will advance each other, engaging in mutual inquiry
They will say, “Before, we were not without fear, because of our people
“But God has been good to us, and has delivered us from the penalty of the scorching wind
“Indeed we used to call on Him. Truly it is He, the Merciful Benefactor, the Merciful Redeemer.”
Therefore proclaim His praises, for by the grace of your Lord, you are no oracle, nor are you one possessed
Or do they call you a poet? We await them with calamity in due time.”
Say, “Wait, I too will wait with you.”
Is it that their mind leads them to this, or are they just a people transgressing beyond bounds
Or do they say, “He fabricated the message?” No, they have no faith
Let them produce a hadith like it, if they speak the truth
Were they created of nothing, or did they create themselves
Or did they create the heavens and the earth? No, they have no firm beliefs
Or are the treasures of your Lord with them, or are they the managers
Or have they a ladder, by which they can listen? Then let such a listener produce clear proof
Or has He only daughters and you have sons
Or is it that you ask for a reward, so that they are burdened with a load of debt
Or is the unknown in their hands, and they write it down
Or do they plot and scheme? But those who defy God are themselves the subject of a plan
Or do they have a god other than God. Exalted is God, far above the things they associate with Him
If they saw a piece of the sky falling, they would say, “Fog-clouds gathered in heaps.”
So leave them alone until they encounter that day of theirs, when they will faint
The day when their plotting will not avail them, and no help will be given to them
And indeed, for those who do wrong, there is another punishment besides this, but most of them do not understand
Now wait in patience, the command of your Lord, for indeed you are in Our Eyes, and glorify your Lord with praise while you stand forth
And for part of the night praise Him, and at the retreat of the stars
By the star when it goes down
Your companion is neither astray nor being misled
Nor does he say anything of his own volition
It is no less than inspiration sent down to him
He was taught by one mighty in power
Endued with wisdom, for he appeared
While he was in the highest part of the horizon
Then he approached and came closer
And was at a distance of only two bow-lengths or nearer
So God conveyed the inspiration to His servant which He meant to convey
His heart in no way falsified that which he saw
Will you then dispute with him concerning what he saw
For indeed he saw him at a second descent
Near the lotus-tree beyond which none may pass
Near is the garden of abode
Behold, the lotus-tree was shrouded
His sight never deviated, nor did it go wrong
For truly he saw the signs of his Lord, the Greatest
Have you seen Lat and ‘Uzza
And another, the third, Manat
What, for you the male, and for Him, the female
Behold, that would indeed be a division unfair

These are nothing but names which you have made up, you and your fathers, for which God has sent down no authority. They follow nothing but speculation, and what their own soul’s desire. Even though there has already come to them guidance from their Lord
No, will human beings have everything they pursue
But it is to God that the end and the beginning belong
However many angels there are in the heavens, their intercession will avail them nothing, except after God has given permission to whom He pleases, and that they are acceptable to Him
Those who do not believe in the hereafter, name the angels with female names
But they cannot know. They follow nothing but speculation, and speculation avails nothing against truth
Therefore turn away from those who turn away from Our message, and desire nothing but the life of the present
That is as far as their knowledge will take them, indeed your Lord knows best those who stray from His path, and He knows best those who receive guidance
Yes, to God belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth. He rewards those who do wrong, according to their deeds, and He rewards those who do right, with what is best

Those who avoid great sins and shameful deeds, only falling into small faults, indeed your Lord is ample in forgiveness. He knows you well when He brings you out of the earth, and when you are hidden in your mothers’ wombs. Therefore do not justify yourselves. He knows best who it is that guards against harm
See the one, who turns back
Gives a little, then hardens
What, have they knowledge of the unknown and can they see it
No, is he not acquainted with what is in the Books of Moses
And of Abraham, who fulfilled his engagements
Namely, that no bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another
That human beings can have nothing but what they strive for
That their striving will soon come into sight
Then they will be rewarded with a reward complete
That to your Lord is the final goal
That it is He Who grants laughter and tears
That it is He Who grants death and life
That He created in pairs, male and female
From a zygote when lodged in its place
That He has promised a second creation
That it is He Who gives wealth and satisfaction
That He is the Lord of Sirius
And that it is He Who caused to perish, the ancient ‘Ad people
And the Thamud, nor gave them a lease of perpetual life
And before them, the people of Noah, because they were all most unjust and most insolent transgressors
And He caused to perish the overthrown cities
And they have been covered up
Then about which of the gifts of your Lord will you dispute
This is a warner, of the series of warners ahead of him
The Ever Approaching draws near
None but God can remove it
Do you then wonder at this recital
And will you laugh and not weep
Wasting your time in vanities
But fall down in prostration to God, in worship to Him
The Hour is near, and the Moon is cleft asunder
But if they see a sign, they turn away and say, “This is a mysterious illusion.”
They reject it and follow their lusts, but every issue has its appointed time
There have already come to them recitals with which there is enough to check them
Perfect wisdom, but warners do not profit them
Therefore, turn away from them. The day that the caller will call them to a terrible affair
They will come forth, their eyes humbled from their graves, torpid like locusts scattered abroad
Hastening with eyes transfixed towards the caller. “This is a trying day,” the unbelievers will say
Before them the people of Noah rejected it. They rejected Our servant and said, “This one is possessed.” And he was driven out
Then he called on his Lord, “I am one overcome, will You help me?”
So We opened the gates of heaven, with water pouring out
And We caused the earth to gush forth with springs, so the waters met and rose to the extent decreed
But We bore him on an ark made of broad planks and caulked with palm-fiber
It floats under our eyes. A reward for one who had been rejected
And We have left it as a sign. Then is there any who will receive advice
But how was My penalty and My warning
And We have indeed made the Quran intuitive. Then are there any who will receive advice
The ‘Ad also rejected it. Then how was My penalty and My warnings
For We sent against them a furious wind, on a day of violent disaster
Plucking out human beings, as if they were roots of palm trees torn up
Yes, how was My penalty and My warning
And indeed We have made the Quran intuitive. Then will any experience it
The Thamud rejected their warners
For they said, “What, a human being, one from among ourselves? Should we follow such a one? Truly we would then be in error, and in madness
“Is it that the message is sent to him of all people among us? No, he is a liar, an insolent one.”
They will know on the morrow, who is the liar, and the insolent one
For We will send the she-camel as a trial for them. So watch them, and be patient
And tell them that the water is to be divided between them. Each one’s right to drink being brought forward
But they called to their companion, and he took a sword in hand, and hamstrung her
How was My penalty and My warning
For We sent against them a single mighty blast, and they became like the dry stubble used by one who pens livestock
And indeed We have made the Quran intuitive. Then will any experience it
The people of Lot rejected the warning
We sent against them a violent tornado with showers of stones which caused them to perish, except Lot’s household. We delivered them by early dawn
As a grace from Us. This is how We reward those who give thanks
And Lot warned them of Our punishment, but they disputed about the warning
And they even sought to abduct his guests, but We blinded their eyes. Now taste My punishment and My warning
Early in the morning an abiding punishment indeed seized them
“So taste My punishment and My warning.”
And indeed We have made the Quran intuitive. Then will any experience it
Also to the people of Pharaoh came warners
The people rejected all of Our signs, but We seized them with a penalty from One Exalted in Power, able to carry out His will
Are your unbelievers better than they are? Or have you immunity in the sacred books
Or do they say, “We, acting together, can defend ourselves”
Soon will their party be on the retreat, and they will show their backs
No, the Hour is the time promised them, and that Hour will be more terrible and most bitter
Truly those in sin are the ones straying in mind, and in madness
The day they will be dragged through the fire on their faces. Taste the touch of hell.”
Indeed, We have created all things in due proportion and measure
And Our command is only a single act, like the blink of an eye
And in the past, We have caused groups like you to perish. Then is there any who will receive advice
All that they do is noted in books
Every matter, small and great, is on record
As for the righteous, they will be in the presence of gardens and rivers
In an assembly of truth, in the presence of the Sovereign, Omnipotent
God, the Merciful Benefactor
It is He Who has taught the Quran
He has created the human being
He has taught him speech
The Sun and the Moon follow courses computed
And the herbs and the trees both bow in adoration
And the firmament has He raised high, and He has established the balance
In order that you may not transgress the balance
So establish weight with justice, and do not fall short with balance
It is He Who has spread out the earth for His creatures
Therein is fruit and date palms producing spathes
Also corn with leaves and stalk for fodder, and sweet-smelling plants
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
He created the human being from sounding clay like pottery
And He created jinn from fire free of smoke
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
Lord of the two Easts and Lord of the two Wests
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
He has let free the two bodies of flowing water meeting together
Between them is a barrier that they do not transgress
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
Out of them come pearls and coral
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
And His are the ships sailing smoothly through the seas lofty as mountains
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
All that is on earth will perish
But will live forever is the Face of your Lord, Full of Majesty, Bounty, and Honor
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
Of Him seeks every creature in the heavens and on earth. Every day in splendor does He shine
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
Soon will We settle your affairs, O both you worlds
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
O you assembly of jinns and humans. If you can pass beyond the zones of the heavens and the earth, then pass. But not without power will you be able to pass
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
On you will be sent a flame of fire and smoke, no defense will you have
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
When the sky is rent asunder, and it becomes red like ointment
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
On that day no question will be asked of human or jinn as to his harmful deeds
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
The wrong-doers will be known by their marks, and they will be seized by their hair and their feet
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
This is the hell which those who are corrupt deny
In it and in boiling hot water which they will wander round
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
But for those who fear the time when they will stand before their Lord, there will be two gardens
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
Containing plants of all kind
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
In them will be two flowing springs
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
In them will be fruits of every kind, two and two
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
They will recline on carpets, whose inner linings will be of rich brocade. The fruit of the gardens will be near
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
In them will be those who are chaste, restraining their glances, whom neither human nor jinn has touched before
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
Like unto rubies and coral
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
Is there any reward for good, other than good
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
And besides these two, there are two other gardens
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
Dark-green in color
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
In them will be two springs pouring forth water in continuous abundance
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
In them will be fruit, dates and pomegranates
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
In them will be those good, and beautiful
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
Companions subtle, in pavilions
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
Whom no human or jinn has touched before them
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
Reclining on green cushions and rich carpets of beauty
Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny
Blessed is the name of your Lord, Full of Majesty, Bounty, and Honor
When the inevitable event comes to pass
Then will no soul entertain falsehood concerning its coming
Many will it bring low, many will it exalt
When the earth will be shaken to its depths
And the mountains will be crumbled to atoms
Becoming dust scattered abroad
And you will be sorted out into three classes
The companions of the right, what are the companions of the right
And the companions of the left, what are the companions of the left
And those foremost, will be foremost
These will be those nearest to God
In gardens of bliss
A number of people from those of the past
And a few from those of later times
On thrones encrusted
Reclining on them, facing each other
Around them will be youth of perpetual innocence
With goblets, bowls, and cups filled from clear-flowing fountains
No after-ache will they receive from it, nor will they suffer intoxication
And fruits, any they may select
And the meat of fowl, any that they may desire
And companions with beautiful eyes
Like pearls well guarded
A reward for the deeds of their past
Neither frivolousness will they hear therein, nor any taint of harm
Only the saying, “Peace, peace.”
The companions of the right hand, what are the companions of the right hand
They will be among lotus trees without thorns
Among Talh trees with flowers piled one above another
In shade long extended
By water flowing constantly
And fruit in abundance
Whose season is not limited, nor prevented
And on thrones, raised high
We have created their companions of a special creation
And made them virgin - pure
Beloved, equal in age
For the companions of the right hand
A number from those in the past
And a number from those of later times
The companions of the left hand, who will be the companions of the left hand
They will be in the middle of a fierce blast of fire and in boiling water
And in the shades of black smoke
Nothing to refresh, or to please them
Because they were accustomed to indulging, before that, with their wealth
And insisted on great harm
And they used to say, “What, when we die and become dust and bones, will we then indeed be raised up again
“And our ancestors?”
Say, “Yes, those in the past and those of later times
“All will certainly be gathered together, for the meeting appointed for a day well-known
“Then will you truly, O you who go wrong by treating truth as falsehood
“You will surely taste of the Tree of Zaqqum
“Then and there you will fill your insides
“And drink boiling water on top of it
“Indeed you will drink like thirsty camels.”
Such will be their entertainment on the Day of Punishment
It is We Who have created you. Why will you not witness the truth
Do you then see that which you throw out
Is it you who create it, or are We the Creators
We have decreed death for you, and We are not to be stopped–
From changing your forms, and creating you in forms that you know not
And you certainly already know the first form of creation. Why then do you not praise Him
Do you see the seed that you sow in the ground
Is it you who cause it to grow, or are We the cause
Were it Our will, We could crumble it to dry powder, and you would be left in wonderment–
Saying, “We are indeed left with debts
“Indeed we are shut out.”
Do you see the water which you drink
Do you bring it down from the cloud or do We
If it were Our will, We could make it salty. So why do you not give thanks
Do you see the fire which you kindle
Is it you who causes the tree to grow which feeds the fire, or do We cause it to grow
We have made it a memorial, an article of comfort, and convenience for the denizens of deserts
Then glorify with praises the name of your Lord, the Supreme
Furthermore, I call to witness the setting of the stars
And that is indeed a mighty adjuration if you only knew
That this is indeed a Quran most honorable
In a book well guarded
Which none will touch but those who are clean
A revelation from the Guardian Evolver of all the systems of knowledge
Is it such a message that you would hold in light esteem
And have you made it your life to declare it false
Then why do you not intervene when the soul reaches the throat
But you just stand there looking on
But We are nearer to him than you, but you see not
Then why do you not, if you are exempt from account
Call back the soul, if you are truthful
Then if he is of those nearest to God
There is for him rest and satisfaction, and a garden of pleasure
And if he is of the companions of the right hand
Then for him is the salutation, “Peace be unto you,” from the companions of the right hand
And if he is of those who treat truth as false, and who go wrong
For him is entertainment with boiling water
And burning in hellfire
Indeed, this is the truth with certainty
So glorify with praises the name of your Lord, the Supreme
That which is in the heavens and on earth, let it declare the praises and glory of God, for He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise
To Him belongs the control of the heavens and the earth. It is He Who gives life and death, and He has power over all things
He is the First and the Last, the Evident and the Hidden, and He has full knowledge of all things

He is the One Who created the heavens and the earth in six days, and is firmly established on the throne. He knows what enters within the earth, and what comes forth out of it, what comes down from heaven, and what mounts up to it, and He is with you wherever you are, and God sees well all that you do
To Him is the control of the heavens and the earth, and all affairs are referred back to God
He merges night into day, and He merges day into night, and He has full knowledge of the secrets of all hearts
Believe in God and His messenger, and give out of that which He has made you inheritors. For those of you who believe and give, for them is a great reward
What cause do you have that you should not believe in God? The messenger invites you to believe in your Lord, and has indeed taken your covenant, if you are people of faith
He is the One Who sends to His servant clear signs, that He may lead you from the depths of darkness into the light. And indeed God is to you Most Kind and Merciful

And what cause do you have that you should not give in the cause of God, for to God belong the origins of the heavens and the earth. Not equal among you are those who sacrificed and fought before the victory, and those who did so later. They are higher in rank than those who sacrificed and fought afterwards, but to all has God promised the best reward, and God is well acquainted with all that you do
Who is he who will loan to God a handsome loan? For God will increase it abundantly to his credit, and he will have a gracious reward

One day you will see of the believing men and the believing women, how their light runs forward before them and by their right hands. Good news for you this day, gardens beneath which rivers flow, to dwell therein forever. This is indeed the highest achievement.”

One day the hypocrites, men and women, will say to the believers, “Wait for us. Let us borrow from your light.” It will be said, “Turn back behind you and seek a light.” So a wall will be put up between them, with a gate therein forever. Within it will be mercy inside and outside, and all throughout will be punishment

Those without will call out, “Were we not with you?” The others will reply, “True, but you led yourselves into temptation, you looked forward but you doubted, and your desires deceived you, until there issued the command of God, and the Deceiver deceived you in respect to God
“This day will no ransom be accepted of you, from those who rejected God.” Your abode is the fire. That is the proper place to claim you, and what a terrible place it is.”

Has not the time arrived for the believers, that their hearts, with all humility, should engage in the remembrance of God and of the truth which has been revealed, and that they should not become like those to whom was given revelation? But long ages passed over them and their hearts grew hard. For many among them are rebellious transgressors
Do you not know that God gives life to the earth after its death? We have already shown the signs plainly to you, that you may learn wisdom
For those who give in charity, men and women, and loan to God a handsome loan, it will be increased abundantly, and they will have a noble reward

And those who believe in God and His messengers, they are the sincere and the witnesses, in the eyes of their Lord. They will have their reward and their light. But those who reject God and deny Our signs, they are the companions of hellfire

Know that the life of the present is but play and entertainment, pomp and boasting, and increasing for yourselves, wealth and children. Here is a similitude, the rain and the growth which it brings forth pleases the hearts of those who plant it, soon it withers, and you will see it grow yellow, then it becomes dry and crumbles away, but in the hereafter is a penalty severe, and forgiveness from God and His grace, and what is the life of the present but stuff of illusion

And for those of you foremost, is forgiveness from your Lord, and a garden the width of heaven and earth, prepared for those who believe in God and His messengers. That is the grace of God which He bestows on whom He pleases, and God is the Lord of grace abounding
No misfortune can happen on earth or in yourselves, except that it is recorded in a decree before We bring it into existence. That is truly easy for God
In order that you may not despair over opportunities that missed you, nor exult over favors bestowed upon you, for God does not love any vain boaster
Such people are greedy, and recommend greed to others. And if any turn back, indeed God is free of all needs, worthy of all praise

We sent our messengers with clear signs, and sent down with them the Book and the balance, that humanity may stand up for justice. And We sent down iron, in which is great power, and many benefits for humanity, that God may make evident who it is who will help, even if unseen, Him and His messengers, for God is Full of Strength, Exalted in Might
And We sent Noah and Abraham, and established in their line the prophetic office and revelation, and some of them were on right guidance, but many of them became rebellious transgressors

Then in their footsteps, We followed them up with more of Our messengers. We sent after them Jesus the son of Mary, and bestowed on him the gospel, and We ordained in the hearts of those who followed him, compassion and mercy. But monasticism which they invented for themselves, We did not prescribe for them. We asked only the seeking for the grace of God, but that, they did not develop as they should have. Still We bestowed on those among them who believed, their reward, but many of them are rebellious transgressors

O you who believe, be conscious of God, and believe in His messenger, and He will bestow on you a double portion of His mercy. He will provide for you a light, by which you will walk, and He will forgive you, for God is Oft-Forgiving, Mercifully Redeeming

So the people of the Book may know that they have no power at all over the grace of God, that His grace is in His hand, to bestow on whomever He wills, for God is the Lord of grace abounding. 29 (End of Part)
